subject: Football
lead_paragraph: Curtis Whitley, a former N.F.L. center who played for three teams in the 1990s and had a history of substance abuse, was found dead in his trailer home in West Texas. The Pecos County sheriff said Wednesday that the 39-year-old Whitley was found Sunday night in Fort Stockton, about 220 miles east of El Paso. Sheriff Cliff Harris said there were no signs of foul play, but the death remains under investigation. Whitley played for San Diego, Carolina and Oakland from 1992-97 and had two suspensions for violating the league’s drug policy.
